thread.title: Ashley Madison scam warning for South Australians
thread.title_full: Ashley Madison scam warning for South Australians | The Australian

author: AAP
title: Ashley Madison scam warning for South Australians
text:
Police have received more than a dozen reports of the emails, which have emerged after hackers in August released the personal details of thousands of Ashley Madison customers.
“The email is being sent to a wide range of people, whether they were registered with the website or not,” Senior Sergeant Barry Blundell said on Tuesday.
“We’ve had more than a dozen reports in the last week and believe it’s just the tip of the iceberg as many more people will have simply deleted the email without advising police.” The scammers, who are not linked to the original Ashley Madison hackers, demand that their targets pay a fee using the online currency Bitcoin.
In one of the emails the scammers threaten to release details of the person’s “secret fantasies, pictures and conversations”. Another threatens to contact family and friends using social media, suggesting their passwords are not secure.
Sgt Blundell says the Ashley Madison scam is among a number of dodgy operations causing concern, including one where an elderly woman was duped into paying almost $500,000 to a bogus government department.
The woman, aged in her 70s, received letters from Reclaim Department Australia telling her she was entitled to various sums of money once she made a final payment for application charges.
AAP
